transcription.text: This painting shows scenes of desperation and suffering in the face of the flood, which God unleashed upon the earth to restore the goodness of his creation, as described in the book of Genesis, chapters 6–9. Turner’s depiction of a powerful Black man rescuing a drowning white woman illustrates the free will of all people to act independently. When a print of this picture was made in 1828, it was dedicated to Lord Carysfort, a prominent advocate for the abolition of slavery.
